titleStmt.title: A strange and lamentable accident that happened lately at Mears-Ashby in Northamptonshire. 1642. Of one Mary Wilmore, wife to Iohn Wilmore rough mason, who was delivered of a childe without a head, and credibly reported to have a firme crosse on the brest, as this ensuing story shall relate.
titleStmt.author: Locke, John, Cleric.

publicationStmt.publisher: for Rich: Harper and Thomas Wine, and are to be sold at the Bible and Harpe in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
